reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup**

 *RDA*/ Velocity *Coil*/ Single Fused Kanthal Clapton 2×26 core 32 6-Wrap *W*/ 45 *Wicking*/ Full Cotton *Ω*/0.26           

**Testing**        

*Steep Time*/4 weeks *% Used*/ 10  
*PG/VG* 50/50 *Nic%*/0    

**Mouth Feel**-  heavy on the palate and nose, extremely dense 10/10 

**Throat Hit**- 0/10                
                   
**Flavor Properties**- Chocolatey, creamy, and smooth.Chocolate is a little Tootsie Roll like and slightly chalky, which adds a little something extra to the cream.

**Relatable Flavors**- I believe  they're going for Oreo cookie pretty close needs a little help.

**Off Flavors**- Not a lot here, as I mentioned earlier a slightly chalky chocolate but it works well with the cream.

**Position In The Recipe**- Should be a great base flavor for any cookies and cream recipe.

**Pairings**- Creams, bakeries, and vanilla's.

**Notes**- Tastes exactly like crushed up oreos. It leans heavier towards the cookie. Chocolaty and crispy with a snap. Very dry. The cream flavor is very pleasant, but lacks the creamy mouth feel. Needs a cream to compliment it. Real Flavors are so good and complex, I'm not sure if I'm buying flavors, or premixed concentrates. Use between 8-12%. 

*These aren't my notes copy and pasted from the link below for a fantastic recipe!! original author is /u/Vurve you did such a good job I just wanted to throw them in*

**Recipe**-  https://www.reddit.com/r/DIY_eJuice/comments/4ig65a/cookies_and_cream_ice_cream/?ref=search_posts

*Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post it in the comments. Will help the master list with multiple reviews in one spot.*
reviewsJson.author: Chrisdvr1
reviewsJson.title: Cookies and Cream VG Version
